item.title: Hello, Hugo!
item.description: I had been running this blog using Jekyll for a while now, but didn’t quite understand how it all worked. Jekyll is a great tool, and you don’t need a whole lot of configuration to get started. If you’re using github to host either personal, project or organisation pages, Jekyll is a no-brainer to get started. However, as I’m not much of a Ruby programmer, I didn’t quite understand how Jekyll worked and having to gem install ruby felt wrong – especially since it also installs a whole lot of other dependencies that I don’t understand, either.
